Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2013 05:05PM Valph wrote: I tried to post earlier, but I have no idea where it went.  Sorry!  I had my third diagnostic mammogram with sonogram today, which showed the return of a small cyst in my right breast.  It was originally aspirated in November and showed atypia.  The Dr. said for us to watch it for two months - and here we are. I am scheduled for a lumpectomy on Friday, and I'm pretty much scared to death.  Everything I read says a fluid-filled cyst that disappears on aspiration is benign - which is what this one did.  But they did a culture, and it came back atypical. I asked the Dr. for some sort of possible diagnosis, and he said intracystic neoplasm.  Anyone ever heard of this, an/or had this before? Thanks for all your great information.
Posts.Title: Not diagnosed yet.....but anxious and worried Concernedmomof2 GramM
